unnormalised: Retail sales in India saw a surge of 15% YoY in Q3 2023, according to a new report by RAI. This increase reflects a strong consumer demand, especially during the festive season. Experts attribute this growth to factors such as increased disposable income and a wider availability of credit options.
normalised: Retail sales in India saw a surge of fifteen percent year over year in Q three two thousand twenty three, according to a new report by R-A-I. This increase reflects a strong consumer demand, especially during the festive season. Experts attribute this growth to factors such as increased disposable income and a wider availability of credit options.

unnormalised: Grocery stores experienced an average transaction value of Rs. 750 per customer, while apparel outlets saw sales reaching Rs 2500 per transaction. Online retail platforms noted a 20% increase in orders, with the average order value (AOV) clocking in at Rs. 1200. Notably, Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities contributed to over 45% of the total online sales during this period, highlighting the growing digital penetration.
